questions.question: During an internal audit, a reviewer asks about the DPA’s principal responsibilities within the SMS. Which statement best summarizes them?
options: Ensure the development and implementation of the SMS and monitor HSQE aspects of Company and fleet operations
Oversee only commercial performance and chartering matters
Supervise vessel classification and certification activities exclusively
Perform voyage optimization and fuel performance monitoring
questions.answer: Ensure the development and implementation of the SMS and monitor HSQE aspects of Company and fleet operations
questions.explanation: The DPA’s core role is to ensure that the SMS is developed, implemented, and effectively monitored in all HSQE areas for Company and fleet operations.

questions.question: What additional responsibility does the QMR hold compared to the DPA under the Company’s structure?
options: Monitoring quality and customer satisfaction aspects of managed ships' operations
Supervising bunkering and cargo operations
Authorizing all purchasing and crewing transactions
Conducting navigation audits onboard
questions.answer: Monitoring quality and customer satisfaction aspects of managed ships' operations
questions.explanation: While the DPA covers HSQE, the QMR focuses on quality assurance and customer satisfaction monitoring across managed ships.

questions.question: Why is the term 'DPA' used throughout the SMS instead of 'DPA/QMR'?
options: To simplify reference and represent both roles collectively within the management system
Because the QMR position was removed from the Company structure
To comply with flag administration terminology only
Because QMR responsibilities were delegated to Masters
questions.answer: To simplify reference and represent both roles collectively within the management system
questions.explanation: The SMS specifies that 'DPA' is used throughout to refer collectively to DPA and QMR responsibilities for simplicity and consistency.

questions.question: Who assumes responsibility for DPA duties in the DPA’s absence?
options: The General Manager
The Deputy DPA
The Safety Officer
The Master of the senior vessel in the fleet
questions.explanation: When the DPA is absent, the Deputy DPA is responsible for carrying out all DPA duties to ensure continuity of oversight.

questions.question: To whom does the DPA report within the Company’s organizational hierarchy?
options: Directly to the Flag Administration
To the General Manager
To the Safety Committee
To the Port Captain
questions.explanation: The DPA reports directly to the General Manager, ensuring a clear line of authority and accountability within the Company.
